incidents.name: Elevated amount of publishing failures
incidents.message: We experienced elevated error rates for publishing and code sync, leading to incomplete publishes and code synchronizations.

incidents.name: Increased errors rate for delivery and publishing
incidents.message:
On March 21st, 2025, starting at 21:36 UTC, one of our cloud providers experienced an outage that had an impact on publishing and delivery. 

Between 21:36 - 22:02 UTC delivery had an increased error rate below 1%

Between 21:36 - 22:45 UTC publishing operations resulted in errors in the sidekick but without impact to the performed operation.

incidents.name: Page Delivery Issues Observed for a single customer
incidents.message: On March 13, 2025, between 2:25 PM and 3:03 PM UTC, a single customer experienced a service disruption due to oversized configuration files exceeding AWS Lambda's response size limit.

incidents.name: Publishing Issues Observed
incidents.message: The cloud storage platform issue has been resolved, and the service has recovered on 09:13 UTC. We will continue to closely monitor the situation.

incidents.name: Page Delivery Issues Observed
incidents.message:
We are observing issues that are affecting page delivery for AEM customers. The issue is under active investigation and we are working with full effort to reach a speedy resolution.

We were experiencing an issue with one of our cloud storage platforms. We have now switched all traffic to a healthy backend and are actively monitoring the situation.

incidents.name: Page Delivery Issues Observed
incidents.message: Beginning January 22, 09:17 UTC, we observed an elevated error rate of approximately 0.1% for less than 1 minute on aem.page and aem.live domains. This issue is attributed to very spiky traffic due to misguided load tests. Similar spikes occurred at 09:27 UTC as well as 15:17 UTC with much less impact.

incidents.name: Traffic blocked by zScaler
incidents.message: We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Publishing issues via AEM Sidekick observed
incidents.message: Between 1:15 PM and 2:04 PM UTC, AEM Sidekick could no longer be loaded and displayed an error message instead.

incidents.name: Logging interruption
incidents.timestamp: Jul <var data-var='date'>30</var>, <var data-var='time'>23:32</var> - Jul <var data-var='date'>31</var>, <var data-var='time'>05:37</var> UTC

incidents.name: Publishing Issues Observed
incidents.message: We are observing issues that are affecting site publishing for AEM customers.

incidents.name: Increased error rate from Cloudflare backends
[Scheduled] Support Slack Migration with Downtime
incidents.message: The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

incidents.name: Page Delivery Issues Observed
incidents.message: Customer specific incident, rate limiting issue.

incidents.name: RUM JavaScript Delivery Partially Delayed
incidents.message: The incident has been resolved and RUM script delivery is working for all customers as expected.

incidents.name: Slow Index Updates
incidents.message: Index updates are processed with significant delays.

incidents.name: Page Delivery Issues Observed
incidents.message: All pending form submissions have been processed as of 19:33 UTC on Thursday, February 1.

incidents.name: Fastly Image Optimizer issue
incidents.message:
We discovered that the errors were caused by an issue with a specific IO region in Fastly. The impact of the incident lasted for approximately 22 minutes, from 11:42 to 12:04 UTC. During that period we saw an increase of the media delivery error rate from 0% to 4.8%. About 50% of the errored requests were initiated by Bots. Customer impact has been negligible.

We will continue to closely monitor error rates of the the infrastructure we are using and take action if necessary.

incidents.name: Cloudflare Workers Issue
incidents.message: A small number of customers running on the Cloudflare stack were affected by the Cloudflare Workers Issue https://www.cloudflarestatus.com/incidents/m6y3t8mxy1c7 that caused slow load times and elevated error rates on hlx.page. This lead to a minor disruption of authoring and preview, but no impact to delivery.

incidents.name: Slack Bot is unable to upload images or videos
incidents.message: The Slack bot now provides correct instructions on uploading files through Sharepoint, Google Drive and Sidekick. Direct uploads from Slack are no longer possible, due to changes in Slack's API and the deprecation of the bot skill.

incidents.name: Delivery Increased Error Rate
incidents.message: Between 19:53 UTC and 20:20 UTC we observed an increased error rate of about 2% of origin requests due to an incident in of one of our cloud providers https://www.cloudflarestatus.com/incidents/l6x2h1zp69bc

incidents.name: [Publishing Issues Observed] Sidekick Library
incidents.message:
We are observing issues that are affecting site publishing for AEM customers. Page delivery is not affected, but updates to your sites may be delayed or prevented. The issue is under active investigation.

A limited set of customers with certain configurations may have seen Sidekick Libraries be impacted by an unrelated change. We are actively working to determine the scope of the impact.

The issue has been resolved in the meantime.

incidents.name: Ongoing DNS Disruption for hlx.page and hlx.live
incidents.message: We have received no more messages from users about DNS resolution errors and consider this closed. As always, a post-mortem will follow in a few days after we had a chance to regroup.

incidents.name: DNS Disruption for hlx.page and hlx.live
incidents.message: Adobe has been experiencing issues with the Domain Name System (DNS) provider that serves hlx.page and hlx.live that caused these domains to be unresolvable from certain networks. Changing the DNS provider to 1.1.1.1 (Cloudflare) or 8.8.8.8 (Google) provided an effective workaround.

incidents.name: Page Delivery And Publishing Issues Observed
Publishing Issues Observed
incidents.message:
The Azure Systems have recovered.

From 7:14AM to 9:29AM UTC we saw 25 related errors of failed publish actions. The impact was therefore only minor.

incidents.name: Increased error rate with the Franklin Admin Service.
incidents.message:
Franklin experienced a temporary increased error rate due to a problem with one of our cloud providers. The outage effected user of the Franklin Admin Service and the Sidekick.

This incident has been resolved.

incidents.name: Increased error rate on media delivery
incidents.message: From 01:03 UTC to 04:04 UTC we saw increased error rates for media requests.

incidents.name: Form Processing Issues Observed
incidents.message: This incident has been resolved and normal form processing restored. No form data was lost.

incidents.name: [Scheduled] Publishing Infrastructure Maintenance
incidents.message: The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

incidents.name: Page Delivery Issues Observed
incidents.message: We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Development Issues Observed

incidents.name: Page Delivery Issues Observed
incidents.message: This issue has been caused by an ill configured robot that requested a large number of former URLs creating contention for various rate limits. The impact seems to have been the creation of errors for the URLs in question.

This incident has been resolved.

incidents.message: We have been observing issues that are affecting developer-related services for Project Helix customers, which may have prevented updates to your site's code or functionality. Content updates to the site work as before and visitors to your site won't be affected.

incidents.message: The service got redeployed about 1h ago and has been working as expected since. We will continue to work with the Adobe I/O Runtime team to identify the root cause.
